=== Configuration procedures ===

==== kernel for Intel® Core™ Duo CPU ====
* install Linux kernel available for Pentium Pro/Celeron/Pentium II/Pentium III/Pentium IV with SMP (symmetric multi-processing) support : <code>$ sudo apt-get install linux-686-smp linux-headers-$(uname -r)</code>
** check that 2 CPU are runing : <pre>
$ cat /proc/cpuinfo
processor       : 0
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
cpu family      : 6
model           : 15
model name      : Intel(R) Core(TM)2 CPU         T5600  @ 1.83GHz
stepping        : 6
cpu MHz         : 1829.006
cache size      : 2048 KB
physical id     : 0
[...]
processor       : 1
vendor_id       : GenuineIntel
cpu family      : 6
model           : 15
model name      : Intel(R) Core(TM)2 CPU         T5600  @ 1.83GHz
stepping        : 6
cpu MHz         : 1829.006
cache size      : 2048 KB
physical id     : 1
[...]
</pre>

==== graphic controller nVidia ====
confere : http://doc.ubuntu-fr.org/nvidia
* install kernel restricted modules : <code>$ sudo apt-get install linux-restricted-modules-$(uname -r)</code>
* install NVIDIA binary XFree8 insta6 4.x/X.Org driver : <code>$ sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx</code>
* configure driver : <code>$ sudo nvidia-xconfig </code>
* restart X
* adjust configuration executing : <code>$ nvidia-settings</code>
* to modify screen resolution :
** add "1280 x 800" to xorg display modes : <pre>
$ gksu gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
Section "Screen"
### [...]
    SubSection     "Display"
##### [...]
        Modes      "1280 x 800" "1024x768" "800x600" "640x480"
    EndSubSection</pre>
** restart X

=== touchpad ===
* https://help.ubuntu.com/community/SynapticsTouchpad
==== turn off while typing ====
Turn on SHMCONFIG : add a to <code>/etc/X11/xorg.conf</code> line <code>Option "SHMConfig" "on"</code> the end of <code>Section "InputDevice"</code>

=== Webcam ===
<pre>
Bus 005 Device 002: ID 0c45:624f Microdia
  idVendor           0x0c45 Microdia
  idProduct          0x624f 
</pre>
more details : http://eric.dane.free.fr/file/AsusW7J-webcam.txt

The built-in webcam on the W7J use the sn9c201 chipset according to this post : http://www.mail-archive.com/linux-uvc-devel@lists.berlios.de/msg00542.html

Finally we have an open source working driver:
* http://groups.google.com/group/microdia

here is a short simple tutorial:
* http://forum.notebookreview.com/showpost.php?p=3278824&postcount=61

Older Project (closed) : 

* http://www.linux-projects.org/modules/newbb/viewtopic.php?topic_id=260&forum=3
* http://www.linuxquestions.org/questions/showthread.php?t=548554

See also
* http://forum.ubuntu-fr.org/viewtopic.php?id=16670&p=57
